newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: ZCCM SACKS 97 MINERS AFTER WORK STOPPAGE.
newsitem.headline: ZCCM SACKS 97 MINERS AFTER WORK STOPPAGE.

text.p: Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) has sacked 97 miners at its Nchanga Division for staging a one-day strike and vandalising company property on Monday, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.
"We have dismissed a total of 97 miners for going on strike and for sabotage of company property," ZCCM spokesman Pius Mambo told Reuters.
Zambian newspaper reports said at least four miners had been arrested for sabotage.
Mambo said further action against the strikers would be announced later on Wednesday.
The miners, on strike to push for bonus pay, vandalised part of a three kilometre stretch of underground lighting, prompting management to call police to restore order at the plant.
Mambo said the workers' action was uncalled for because ZCCM intended to give them bonus pay.
"They do not understand that we have to create a structure under which bonuses can be paid," he added.
Nchanga is responsible for about 50 percent of ZCCM production. ZCCM copper production totalled 25,141 tonnes in August when cobalt output was 441 tonnes.
